etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Samuel Frederick Gray (1766–1828), naturalist and pharmacologist. From scientific Latin epichilium from epi- + ancient Greek χεῖλος lip, rim + post-classical Latin -ium

definitions: In an orchid flower: the terminal part of any labellum divided into distinct sections; = epichile. Compare "hypochilium", mesochilium.
